title: Houston girl, 15, takes her own life after she was rescued from a sex trafficking ring
text:
Family members of a 15-year-old sex trafficking victim from Houston are pleading for justice after they say the teen took her own life over the weekend, two years after being drugged and sexually abused.

Leticia Serrano, known to her loved ones as Letty, in May celebrated her 15th birthday with a lavish quinceanera party, complete with a ruby-red princess ballgown, bouquets of roses and a dessert bar.

Six months later, her father, Mariano Serrano, says his daughter locked herself in the bathroom and committed suicide as he desperately tried to reach her.

Scroll down for video

Tragic: Leticia 'Letty' Serrano, a 15-year-old sex trafficking victim, took her own life on Saturday in Houston

Letty, pictured at her quinceanera birthday celebration in May, locked herself in the bathroom as her father tried to reach her

By the time he opened the door, it was too late for Letty.

'She died in my arms,' the heartbroken father told Fox 26 in Spanish.

Serrano believes his daughter could not bear to be apart from the older man who pulled her into a sex trafficking ring when she was 13 years old and got her addicted to drugs.

'She wanted to be with him,' he said. 'But she also didn't want to hurt her family.'

Letty was a high-achieving student at Marshall Middle School in 2017 when she was drugged and taken by the sex trafficker not far from campus, according to her father.

He said he, and Letty's godmother, Cynthia Rivera, spent days searching for the teenager before tehy found her inside an abandoned home. They then took her to safety, and reported her captor to police.

But Letty's family said in a separate interview with KTRK that the girl they brought back home was not the same girl who had left.

When Letty was 13 years old in 2017 (pictured in missing poster at the time), she was drugged and forced into sex work by an older man. Her family rescued her after a few days, but they say she was not the same person

Mariano Serrano, Letty's father (left), and Cynthia Rivera, her godmother, now want the sex trafficker to face justice

'We got her back damaged,' Rivera said.

Since her rescue, Letty had run away from home twice to be with her abductor, who the family say preyed on the teen's weaknesses, including the fact that she was a loner at school and that her brother had recently died.

To make matters worse, Letty's godmother said the sex trafficker was freed just days after being arrested.

Now, Rivera and Mariano Serrano are blaming the unnamed man for Letty's suicide and want him to face justice.

'I want to see him in court,' the father told Fox 26. 'I want to tell him it's his fault my daughter is dead.'

A commander with the Houston Police Department told the station that he is taking steps toward reopening the sex trafficking case involving Letty.

Meanwhile, the girl's godmother has launched a fundraiser through Facebook to pay for her funeral.

For confidential support call the National Suicide Prevention Line on 1-800-273-8255.
description: Letty Serrano was 13 years old in 2017 when she was drugged and forced into a sex trafficking ring. She was rescued after several days by her family, but on Saturday she took her own life.
